intro: Neillia rubiflora, commonly known as the red-flowered neillia, is a flowering plant native to specific regions of South America. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes many ornamental and economically important species. The plant is characterized by its striking red flowers that bloom in clusters, adding visual interest to gardens. Its leaves are typically elliptical and have a glossy surface, contributing to its ornamental value. Neillia rubiflora prefers well-drained soil and partial to full sunlight, making it suitable for cultivation in tropical and subtropical climates.
